author: seamonkey82
content: <@!524738020033691659> Why is it that when I pass `--rpc-http-enabled --rpc-http-port=8571` besu attempts to open up a second JSON-RPC on port 8550?

author: suburbandad_
content:
8550 is the execution engine json-rpc endpoint.  execution clients will by default have 
8545-> json rpc 
8546 -> web sockets
8550 -> execution engine json-rpc (jwt auth'd)
8551 -> execution engine web sockets (jwt auth'd)

author: suburbandad_
content:
for besu, you need to use `--engine-rpc-http-port` and `--engine-rpc-ws-port`

the docs PR hasn't merged yet, but the details are here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu-docs/pull/967/files

content: Perfect.  Thanks!
